attributes.action: Stop the collation government with labour. It was not voted for
attributes.background: Our Prime Minister has now started talks with Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn. They are together deciding the outcome of Brexit. This is a collation that was never voted for.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action. There isn't a coalition government, so we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

In any case, we can only accept petitions which call for actions that are the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament as a whole. It's the responsibility of the party leaders themselves to decide whether to hold talks about Brexit.  

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
